docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23--The European war has come uncomfortably close to the Americas, so close that the twenty-one republics of the Western Hemisphere are ready for a new step to protect their shores.

docs.snippet: A forest of tapering masts and rakish funnels rose above Southampton Water and the Solent on May 20, 1937. The power and glory of Britain and men-of-war of seventeen other nations rode at anchor upon the misty waters to do homage to a new-crowned...
docs.lead_paragraph: A forest of tapering masts and rakish funnels rose above Southampton Water and the Solent on May 20, 1937. The power and glory of Britain and men-of-war of seventeen other nations rode at anchor upon the misty waters to do homage to a new-crowned king.

docs.snippet: Hopes of bringing two new Latin American exhibitors--Paraguay and Colombia--to the New York World's Fair in 1940 were expressed yesterday by Edward F. Roosevelt, Fair director of foreign participation, on his return from an air tour of South America.

headline.main: FAIR'S LATIN ENVOY BRINGS NEW HOPES; E.F. Roosevelt, Back From Air Tour, Declares Colombia and Paraguay Are Prospects FEELS SURE OF 1939 GROUP Head of Foreign Participation Hopeful of Winning Five Nations on Next Trip
